what.title: What is EORI?
what.subtitle: Understanding EU Economic Operator Registration and Identification
what.desc1: EORI (Economic Operators Registration and Identification number) is a mandatory requirement for businesses engaged in trade activities within the European Union.
what.desc2: It serves as a unique identifier throughout the EU, used to identify economic operators in their dealings with customs authorities and other government agencies.
points: Mandatory requirement for EU import/export activities
Valid across all EU member states

reasons.title: Compliance
reasons.desc: According to EU regulations, all economic operators involved in EU trade must have an EORI number

reasons.title: Customs Clearance
reasons.desc: EORI significantly simplifies customs procedures and reduces cargo detention time

reasons.title: Risk Management
reasons.desc: Helps businesses better manage trade risks and improve supply chain predictability

steps.title: Document Preparation
steps.desc: Including company registration documents, legal representative ID, and other required materials

steps.title: Submit Application
steps.desc: Submit through our professional team to ensure accuracy and completeness

steps.title: Review Process
steps.desc: EU customs authorities review the application, typically taking 3-5 working days

steps.title: Obtain EORI
steps.desc: EORI number is issued upon approval and can be used immediately

items.q: How long is an EORI number valid?
items.a: EORI numbers are valid indefinitely unless there are significant changes to company information or voluntary cancellation

items.q: Is EORI required for all EU trade?
items.a: Yes, EORI is required for all import/export activities within the EU

items.q: How can I verify an EORI number?
items.a: EORI numbers can be verified through the official EU EORI validation system
